parameters.name: CurrentPage
parameters.description: The page number of the page to return. Default value: 1.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The ID of the data asset to which the table belongs. You can call the [DescribeInstances](~~DescribeInstances~~) operation to obtain the ID of the data asset.

parameters.name: Lang
parameters.description:
The language of the content within the request and response. Default value: **zh_cn**. Valid values:

*   **zh_cn**: Chinese
*   **en_us**: English

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The search keyword. Fuzzy match is supported. For example, if you specify test, all tables whose names contain test are retrieved.

parameters.name: PackageId
parameters.description: The ID of the package to which the table belongs. You can call the [DescribePackages](~~DescribePackages~~) operation to obtain the ID of the package.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: The number of entries to return on each page. Default value: 10.

parameters.name: ProductCode
parameters.description: The name of the service to which the table belongs, such as MaxCompute, OSS, and ApsaraDB RDS. For more information about the types of data assets from which Data Security Center (DSC) can scan for sensitive data, see [Supported data assets](~~212906~~).

parameters.name: ProductId
parameters.description: The ID of the service to which the table belongs. You can call the [DescribeDataAssets](~~DescribeDataAssets~~) operation to obtain the ID of the service.

parameters.name: RiskLevelId
parameters.description:
The sensitivity level of the table. Each sensitivity level ID corresponds to a sensitivity level name. Valid values:

*   **1**: N/A, which indicates that no sensitive data is detected.
*   **2**: S1, which indicates the low sensitivity level.
*   **3**: S2, which indicates the medium sensitivity level.
*   **4**: S3, which indicates the high sensitivity level.
*   **5**: S4, which indicates the highest sensitivity level.

parameters.name: RuleId
parameters.description: The ID of the sensitive data detection rule that the table hits. You can call the [DescribeRules](~~DescribeRules~~) operation to obtain the ID of the sensitive data detection rule.

parameters.name: ServiceRegionId
parameters.description: The region in which DSC is activated. For more information, see [Supported regions](~~214257~~).

parameters.name: TemplateId
parameters.description: The ID of the industry-specific rule template.
